snippet: Anti-immigration passions have roiled the Republican Party through the primary and debate season. And the shifting views of one Republican presidential candidate seen by some as a rising star, Marco Rubio, are under attack.
abstract: Vacillations throughout Marco Rubio's political career on immigration policy have emerged as subject of attacks as he seeks Republican presidential nomination; Rubio backed away from hard-line stance to pursue immigration overhaul, reversed position following that legislation's failure, and has now taken an even more severe stance amid presidential bid.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters reported from West Palm Beach, and Ashley Parker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Anti-immigration passions have roiled the Republican Party through the primary and debate season. And the shifting views of one Republican presidential candidate seen by some as a rising star, Marco Rubio, are under attack.

headline.main: Marco Rubio’s History on Immigration Leaves Conservatives Distrustful of Shift
headline.print_headline: Rubio’s History on Immigration Leaves Conservatives Distrustful of Shift
